body_html:
Hey @bamos! So, if I understand correctly, cuSolver only supports CSR/CSC tensors, but PyTorch's current sparse representation only supports COO at the moment. So, there is nothing to talk about: you simply can't use the existing representation to represent the inputs.

Maybe at some point we should add support for CSR/CSC.
body_text:
Hey @bamos! So, if I understand correctly, cuSolver only supports CSR/CSC tensors, but PyTorch's current sparse representation only supports COO at the moment. So, there is nothing to talk about: you simply can't use the existing representation to represent the inputs.
Maybe at some point we should add support for CSR/CSC.
body:
Hey @bamos! So, if I understand correctly, cuSolver only supports CSR/CSC tensors, but PyTorch's current sparse representation only supports COO at the moment. So, there is nothing to talk about: you simply can't use the existing representation to represent the inputs.

Maybe at some point we should add support for CSR/CSC.
